title: Boris Johnson's Brexit deal provides a path out of this rancorous wood. Let's start on it today
text:
We were right to vote against Theresa May’s deal which would have shackled the UK, a rule taker, to the EU.

The deal before us today, though an agonising compromise, is much better. It no longer so stacks the deck against us for future negotiations. Under it we will not have to give up control to the EU - of fishing, farming, defence and defence manufacturing, future trade terms, border procedures, regulation, and parts of our Union - to move to more normal independent trading relationships with the world.

There are wrinkles we could have ironed out if the Benn Act had not been passed. It’s a lesson for the future that unity...
description: We were right to vote against Theresa May’s deal which would have shackled the UK, a rule taker, to the EU.
